subject: Home & DIY
title: The Crystal Palace Sensation
description: Learn The Crystal Palace Sensation in one minute.

hook.text: In 1851, London built a glass palace covering 19 acres in just 5 months. It was the world's first prefab building.

buildup.text: Joseph Paxton, a gardener, designed it based on his greenhouse experience. Architects mocked the idea.

discovery.text: Every piece was mass-produced offsite and bolted together on locationâ€”a technique nobody had tried at this scale.

twist.text: The building was meant to be temporary but became so beloved that it was moved and rebuilt in South London.

climax.text: Prefabrication, modular design, and glass curtain wallsâ€”the Crystal Palace predicted modern architecture by a century.

punchline.text: A gardener outdesigned every architect in London.
